signature.pp: (ε x y : ℝ) : Prop

ref.pp:
abbrev Close (ε x y : ℝ) : Prop :=
  dist x y ≤ ε

signature.pp: (ε x y : ℝ) : ε.Close x y ↔ dist x y ≤ ε

ref.pp:
/-- Definition 6.1.2 (ε-close). This is similar to the previous notion of ε-closeness, but where
  all quantities are real instead of rational.
-/
theorem close_def (ε x y : ℝ) : ε.Close x y ↔ dist x y ≤ ε := by rfl

/-- Definition 6.1.3 (Sequence). This is similar to the Chapter 5 sequence, except that now the
  sequence is real-valued. As with Chapter 5, we start sequences from 0 by default.
-/
@[ext]
structure Sequence where
  m : ℤ
  seq : ℤ → ℝ
  vanish : ∀ n < m, seq n = 0

signature.pp: : CoeFun Sequence (fun _ ↦ ℤ → ℝ)

ref.pp:
/-- Sequences can be thought of as functions from ℤ to ℝ. -/
instance instCoeFun : CoeFun Sequence (fun _ ↦ ℤ → ℝ) where coe a := a.seq

signature.pp: (a : ℕ → ℝ) : Sequence

ref.pp:
@[coe]
abbrev ofNatFun (a : ℕ → ℝ) : Sequence :=
  { m := 0
    seq n := if n ≥ 0 then a n.toNat else 0
    vanish := by simp_all }

signature.pp: : Coe (ℕ → ℝ) Sequence

ref.pp:
/-- Functions from ℕ to ℝ can be thought of as sequences. -/
instance instCoe : Coe (ℕ → ℝ) Sequence where coe := ofNatFun

ref.pp:
abbrev mk' (m : ℤ) (a : { n // n ≥ m } → ℝ) : Sequence
    where
  m := m
  seq n := if h : n ≥ m then a ⟨n, h⟩ else 0
  vanish := by simp_all

signature.pp: {n m : ℤ} (a : { n // n ≥ m } → ℝ) (h : n ≥ m) : (Sequence.mk' m a) n = a ⟨n, h⟩

ref.pp: theorem eval_mk {n m : ℤ} (a : { n // n ≥ m } → ℝ) (h : n ≥ m) : (Sequence.mk' m a) n = a ⟨n, h⟩ := by simp [h]

@[simp]
theorem eval_coe (n : ℕ) (a : ℕ → ℝ) : (a : Sequence) n = a n := by simp

ref.pp:
/-- a.from n₁ starts `a:Sequence` from `n₁`.  It is intended for use when `n₁ ≥ n₀`, but returns
  the "junk" value of the original sequence `a` otherwise.
-/
abbrev «from» (a : Sequence) (m₁ : ℤ) : Sequence :=
  mk' (max a.m m₁) (a ↑·)

signature.pp: (a : Sequence) {m₁ n : ℤ} (hn : n ≥ m₁) : (a.from m₁) n = a n

ref.pp:
theorem from_eval (a : Sequence) {m₁ n : ℤ} (hn : n ≥ m₁) : (a.from m₁) n = a n := by simp [hn]; intros; symm;
  solve_by_elim [a.vanish]

/-- Definition 6.1.3 (ε-steady) -/
abbrev Steady (ε : ℝ) (a : Chapter6.Sequence) : Prop :=
  ∀ n ≥ a.m, ∀ m ≥ a.m, ε.Close (a n) (a m)

signature.pp: (ε : ℝ) (a : Chapter6.Sequence) : ε.Steady a ↔ ∀ n ≥ a.m, ∀ m ≥ a.m, ε.Close (a n) (a m)

ref.pp:
/-- Definition 6.1.3 (ε-steady) -/
theorem steady_def (ε : ℝ) (a : Chapter6.Sequence) : ε.Steady a ↔ ∀ n ≥ a.m, ∀ m ≥ a.m, ε.Close (a n) (a m) := by rfl

ref.pp:
/-- Definition 6.1.3 (Eventually ε-steady) -/
abbrev EventuallySteady (ε : ℝ) (a : Chapter6.Sequence) : Prop :=
  ∃ N ≥ a.m, ε.Steady (a.from N)

signature.pp: (ε : ℝ) (a : Chapter6.Sequence) : ε.EventuallySteady a ↔ ∃ N, (N ≥ a.m) ∧ ε.Steady (a.from N)

ref.pp:
/-- Definition 6.1.3 (Eventually ε-steady) -/
theorem eventuallySteady_def (ε : ℝ) (a : Chapter6.Sequence) :
    ε.EventuallySteady a ↔ ∃ N, (N ≥ a.m) ∧ ε.Steady (a.from N) := by rfl

ref.pp:
/-- For fixed s, the function ε ↦ ε.Steady s is monotone -/
theorem mono {a : Chapter6.Sequence} {ε₁ ε₂ : ℝ} (hε : ε₁ ≤ ε₂) (hsteady : ε₁.Steady a) : ε₂.Steady a := by grind

signature.pp: {a : Chapter6.Sequence} {ε₁ ε₂ : ℝ} (hε : ε₁ ≤ ε₂) (hsteady : ε₁.EventuallySteady a) : ε₂.EventuallySteady a

ref.pp:
/-- For fixed s, the function ε ↦ ε.EventuallySteady s is monotone -/
theorem mono {a : Chapter6.Sequence} {ε₁ ε₂ : ℝ} (hε : ε₁ ≤ ε₂) (hsteady : ε₁.EventuallySteady a) :
    ε₂.EventuallySteady a := by peel 2 hsteady; grind [Steady.mono]

signature.pp: (a : Sequence) : Prop

ref.pp:
/-- Definition 6.1.3 (Cauchy sequence) -/
abbrev IsCauchy (a : Sequence) : Prop :=
  ∀ ε > (0 : ℝ), ε.EventuallySteady a

signature.pp: (a : Sequence) : a.IsCauchy ↔ ∀ ε > (0 : ℝ), ε.EventuallySteady a

ref.pp:
/-- Definition 6.1.3 (Cauchy sequence) -/
theorem isCauchy_def (a : Sequence) : a.IsCauchy ↔ ∀ ε > (0 : ℝ), ε.EventuallySteady a := by rfl

signature.pp: (a : ℕ → ℝ) : (a : Sequence).IsCauchy ↔ ∀ ε > 0, ∃ N, ∀ j ≥ N, ∀ k ≥ N, dist (a j) (a k) ≤ ε

ref.pp:
/-- This is almost the same as Chapter5.Sequence.IsCauchy.coe -/
theorem coe (a : ℕ → ℝ) : (a : Sequence).IsCauchy ↔ ∀ ε > 0, ∃ N, ∀ j ≥ N, ∀ k ≥ N, dist (a j) (a k) ≤ ε :=
  by
  peel with ε hε
  constructor
  · rintro ⟨N, hN, h'⟩
    lift N to ℕ using hN; use N
    intro j hj k hk
    simp [Real.steady_def] at h'
    specialize h' j ?_ k ?_ <;> try omega
    simp_all
  rintro ⟨N, h'⟩; refine ⟨max N 0, by simp, ?_⟩
  intro n hn m hm; simp at hn hm
  have npos : 0 ≤ n := by omega
  have mpos : 0 ≤ m := by omega
  simp [hn, hm, npos, mpos]
  lift n to ℕ using npos
  lift m to ℕ using mpos
  specialize h' n ?_ m ?_ <;> try grind

signature.pp:
{n₀ : ℤ} (a : { n // n ≥ n₀ } → ℝ) :
  (mk' n₀ a).IsCauchy ↔ ∀ ε > 0, ∃ N ≥ n₀, ∀ j ≥ N, ∀ k ≥ N, dist (mk' n₀ a j) (mk' n₀ a k) ≤ ε

ref.pp:
theorem mk {n₀ : ℤ} (a : { n // n ≥ n₀ } → ℝ) :
    (mk' n₀ a).IsCauchy ↔ ∀ ε > 0, ∃ N ≥ n₀, ∀ j ≥ N, ∀ k ≥ N, dist (mk' n₀ a j) (mk' n₀ a k) ≤ ε :=
  by
  peel with ε hε
  constructor
  · rintro ⟨N, hN, h'⟩; refine ⟨N, hN, ?_⟩
    dsimp at hN
    intro j hj k hk
    simp only [Real.Steady, show max n₀ N = N by omega] at h'
    specialize h' j ?_ k ?_ <;> try omega
    simp_all [show n₀ ≤ j by omega, show n₀ ≤ k by omega]
  rintro ⟨N, _, _⟩; use max n₀ N; grind

    ε.EventuallySteady a ↔ (ε : ℝ).EventuallySteady (a : Sequence) := by sorry

signature.pp: (a : Chapter5.Sequence) : a.IsCauchy ↔ (a : Sequence).IsCauchy

ref.pp:
/-- Proposition 6.1.4 -/
theorem isCauchy_of_rat (a : Chapter5.Sequence) : a.IsCauchy ↔ (a : Sequence).IsCauchy := by
  -- This proof is written to follow the structure of the original text.
  
  constructor
  swap
  . intro h; rw [isCauchy_def] at h
    rw [Chapter5.Sequence.isCauchy_def]
    intro ε hε
    specialize h ε (by positivity)
    rwa [is_eventuallySteady_of_rat]
  intro h
  rw [Chapter5.Sequence.isCauchy_def] at h
  rw [isCauchy_def]
  intro ε hε
  choose ε' hε' hlt using exists_pos_rat_lt hε
  specialize h ε' hε'
  rw [is_eventuallySteady_of_rat] at h
  exact h.mono (le_of_lt hlt)

  ∃ N ≥ a.m, ε.CloseSeq (a.from N) L

    ε.EventuallyClose a L ↔ ∃ N, (N ≥ a.m) ∧ ε.CloseSeq (a.from N) L := by rfl

ref.pp:
theorem coe (ε : ℝ) (a : ℕ → ℝ) (L : ℝ) : (ε.CloseSeq a L) ↔ ∀ n, dist (a n) L ≤ ε :=
  by
  constructor
  . intro h n; specialize h n; grind
  . intro h n hn; lift n to ℕ using (by omega); specialize h n; grind

ref.pp:
theorem mono {a : Chapter6.Sequence} {ε₁ ε₂ L : ℝ} (hε : ε₁ ≤ ε₂) (hclose : ε₁.CloseSeq a L) : ε₂.CloseSeq a L := by
  peel 2 hclose; rw [Real.Close, Real.dist_eq] at *; linarith

    ε₂.EventuallyClose a L := by peel 2 hclose; grind [CloseSeq.mono]

ref.pp:
noncomputable def seq_6_1_6 : Sequence :=
  (fun (n : ℕ) ↦ 1 - (10 : ℝ) ^ (-(n : ℤ) - 1) : Sequence)

signature.pp: : (0.1 : ℝ).CloseSeq seq_6_1_6 1

ref.pp:
/-- Examples 6.1.6 -/
example : (0.1 : ℝ).CloseSeq seq_6_1_6 1 :=
  by
  rw [seq_6_1_6, Real.CloseSeq.coe]
  intro n
  rw [Real.dist_eq, abs_sub_comm,
    abs_of_nonneg
      (by
        rw [sub_nonneg]
        rw (occs := .pos [2]) [show (1 : ℝ) = 1 - 0 by norm_num]
        gcongr
        positivity),
    sub_sub_cancel, show (0.1 : ℝ) = (10 : ℝ) ^ (-1 : ℤ) by norm_num]
  gcongr <;> grind

signature.pp: (a : Sequence) {L L' : ℝ} (h : L ≠ L') : ¬(a.TendsTo L ∧ a.TendsTo L')

ref.pp:
/-- Proposition 6.1.7 (Uniqueness of limits) -/
theorem tendsTo_unique (a : Sequence) {L L' : ℝ} (h : L ≠ L') : ¬(a.TendsTo L ∧ a.TendsTo L') := by
  -- This proof is written to follow the structure of the original text.
  
  by_contra this
  choose hL hL' using this
  replace h : L - L' ≠ 0 := by grind
  replace h : |L - L'| > 0 := by positivity
  set ε := |L - L'| / 3
  have hε : ε > 0 := by positivity
  rw [tendsTo_iff] at hL hL'
  specialize hL ε hε; choose N hN using hL
  specialize hL' ε hε; choose M hM using hL'
  set n := max N M
  specialize hN n (by omega)
  specialize hM n (by omega)
  have : |L - L'| ≤ 2 * |L - L'| / 3 :=
    calc
      _ = dist L L' := by rw [Real.dist_eq]
      _ ≤ dist L (a.seq n) + dist (a.seq n) L' := (dist_triangle _ _ _)
      _ ≤ ε + ε := by rw [← Real.dist_eq] at hN hM; rw [dist_comm] at hN; gcongr
      _ = 2 * |L - L'| / 3 := by grind
  linarith

  ∃ L, a.TendsTo L

ref.pp:
/-- Definition 6.1.8.  We give the limit of a sequence the junk value of 0 if it is not convergent.
-/
noncomputable abbrev lim (a : Sequence) : ℝ :=
  if h : a.Convergent then h.choose else 0

signature.pp: {a : Sequence} (h : a.Convergent) : a.TendsTo (lim a)

ref.pp:
/-- Definition 6.1.8 -/
theorem lim_def {a : Sequence} (h : a.Convergent) : a.TendsTo (lim a) := by simp [lim, h]; exact h.choose_spec

signature.pp: {a : Sequence} {L : ℝ} : a.TendsTo L ↔ a.Convergent ∧ lim a = L

ref.pp:
/-- Definition 6.1.8-/
theorem lim_eq {a : Sequence} {L : ℝ} : a.TendsTo L ↔ a.Convergent ∧ lim a = L :=
  by
  constructor
  . intro h; by_contra! eq
    have : a.Convergent := by rw [convergent_def]; use L
    replace eq := a.tendsTo_unique (eq this)
    apply lim_def at this; tauto
  intro ⟨h, rfl⟩; convert lim_def h

signature.pp: : ((fun (n : ℕ) ↦ (n + 1 : ℝ)⁻¹) : Sequence).Convergent ∧ lim ((fun (n : ℕ) ↦ (n + 1 : ℝ)⁻¹) : Sequence) = 0

ref.pp:
/-- Proposition 6.1.11 -/
theorem lim_harmonic :
    ((fun (n : ℕ) ↦ (n + 1 : ℝ)⁻¹) : Sequence).Convergent ∧ lim ((fun (n : ℕ) ↦ (n + 1 : ℝ)⁻¹) : Sequence) = 0 := by
  -- This proof is written to follow the structure of the original text.
  
  rw [← lim_eq, tendsTo_iff]
  intro ε hε
  choose N hN using exists_int_gt (1 / ε); use N; intro n hn
  have hNpos : (N : ℝ) > 0 := by apply LT.lt.trans _ hN; positivity
  simp at hNpos
  have hnpos : n ≥ 0 := by linarith
  simp [hnpos, abs_inv]
  calc
    _ ≤ (N : ℝ)⁻¹ := by
      rw [inv_le_inv₀] <;> try positivity
      calc
        _ ≤ (n : ℝ) := by simp [hn]
        _ = (n.toNat : ℤ) := by simp [hnpos]
        _ = n.toNat := rfl
        _ ≤ (n.toNat : ℝ) + 1 := by linarith
        _ ≤ _ := le_abs_self _
    _ ≤ ε := by
      rw [inv_le_comm₀] <;> try positivity
      rw [← inv_eq_one_div _] at hN; order

ref.pp:
instance inst_add : Add Sequence where
  add a
    b :=
    { m := max a.m b.m
      seq n := if n ≥ max a.m b.m then a n + b n else 0
      vanish n hn := by rw [lt_iff_not_ge] at hn; simp [hn] }

ref.pp:
theorem add_coe (a b : ℕ → ℝ) : (a : Sequence) + (b : Sequence) = (fun n ↦ a n + b n) :=
  by
  ext n; rfl
  by_cases h : n ≥ 0 <;> simp [h, HAdd.hAdd, Add.add]

signature.pp: : Mul Sequence

ref.pp:
instance inst_mul : Mul Sequence where
  mul a
    b :=
    { m := max a.m b.m
      seq n := if n ≥ max a.m b.m then a n * b n else 0
      vanish := by grind }

signature.pp: (a b : ℕ → ℝ) : (a : Sequence) * (b : Sequence) = (fun n ↦ a n * b n)

ref.pp:
theorem mul_coe (a b : ℕ → ℝ) : (a : Sequence) * (b : Sequence) = (fun n ↦ a n * b n) :=
  by
  ext n; rfl
  by_cases h : n ≥ 0 <;> simp [h, HMul.hMul, Mul.mul]

signature.pp: : SMul ℝ Sequence

ref.pp:
instance inst_smul : SMul ℝ Sequence where
  smul c
    a :=
    { m := a.m
      seq n := c * a n
      vanish n hn := by simp [a.vanish n hn] }

signature.pp: (c : ℝ) (a : ℕ → ℝ) : (c • (a : Sequence)) = (fun n ↦ c * a n)

  by
  ext n; rfl
  by_cases h : n ≥ 0 <;> simp [h, HSMul.hSMul, SMul.smul]

signature.pp: : Inv Sequence

ref.pp:
noncomputable instance inst_inv : Inv Sequence where
  inv
    a :=
    { m := a.m
      seq n := (a n)⁻¹
      vanish n hn := by simp [a.vanish n hn] }

signature.pp: (a : ℕ → ℝ) : (a : Sequence)⁻¹ = (fun n ↦ (a n)⁻¹)

ref.pp:
theorem inv_coe (a : ℕ → ℝ) : (a : Sequence)⁻¹ = (fun n ↦ (a n)⁻¹) :=
  by
  ext n; rfl
  by_cases h : n ≥ 0 <;> simp [h, Inv.inv]
  change (0 : ℝ)⁻¹ = 0; simp
